title: Class X Students To Be Graded For Activities That Promote Patriotism, Self-Sacrifice: Report
text:
Class X Students To Be Graded For Activities That Promote Patriotism, Self-Sacrifice: Report Notification issued to CBSE schools. 01/02/2017 9:05 AM IST | Updated 1 hour ago   AFP/Getty Images Representational image. ADVERTISEMENT 
Schools under the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) have been notified that Class X students will receive grades for their performance in activities that promote "patriotism, self-sacrifice." 
The Hindustan Times reported today that students will be graded from A to E on activities such as yoga, martial arts, sports, and the National Cadet Corps. The grades will be included on their mark sheets, but not influence the overall result, HT reported . 
"Students should be provided opportunities to get professionally trained in the areas of their interest. Indigenous sports, yoga and NCC must be encouraged in the schools to create a sense of physical fitness, discipline, sportsmanship, patriotism, self-sacrifice and health care," the notification reads. 
Last year, the Governing Body of the CBSE restored the Class X board exam after a seven-year-long hiatus, and decided to introduce an eligibility test for principals.
